meanings.definition: The fold of skin at the base of a fingernail or toenail.
meanings.sent1: She painted her nailfold with a bright color.
meanings.sent2: The manicurist carefully pushed back the nailfold before applying polish.
meanings.sent3: The tiny bug crawled along her nailfold, tickling her.
meanings.sent4: The nailfold was like a protective shield for her delicate nail bed.
meanings.sent5: Her nailfold was so smooth and neat, like a little curtain for her nail.

meanings.definition: To wrap or wind around something tightly.
meanings.sent1: He used a rope to nailfold the boxes together for shipping.
meanings.sent2: The snake will nailfold itself around the tree branch to rest.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to nailfold the yarn ball but got tangled up instead.
meanings.sent4: The vines seemed to nailfold around the old house, giving it a mysterious look.
meanings.sent5: She watched the scarf nailfold around her neck to keep her warm in the cold wind.
